services.name: AI-Powered Storyboard Generator
services.overview: The AI-Powered Storyboard Generator is a SaaS platform designed to automate and streamline the storyboard creation process for webtoon artists, writers, and small studios. By leveraging advanced AI models, the tool analyzes script or prose input to identify key scenes, actions, and character interactions. It then generates a comprehensive storyboard with suggested panel layouts, character poses, camera angles, and scene descriptions. This significantly reduces the time and cost associated with manual storyboard creation, allowing artists to focus on refining and enhancing their final artwork. The platform aims to democratize webtoon production by lowering the barrier to entry and enabling creators to bring their stories to life more efficiently.
problems_addressed: High initial production costs associated with hiring storyboard artists.
Bottleneck in webtoon production due to the complexity and skill required for storyboarding.
target_users: Webtoon Artists: Professional and aspiring webtoon artists seeking to improve efficiency and reduce workload.
Webtoon Writers: Writers who want to visualize their stories and collaborate effectively with artists.
Small Webtoon Studios: Studios looking to reduce production costs and accelerate their output.
core_features: Script Input and Parsing: Accepts script or prose input in various formats (text, .docx, .pdf) and parses it to identify key scenes, actions, characters, and dialogue.

AI-Powered Panel Generation: Uses a pre-trained AI model to generate storyboard panels based on the parsed script, suggesting layouts, character poses, camera angles, and scene descriptions. The AI is trained on a massive dataset of webtoon panels and art styles.
Customizable Style Presets: Allows users to select from a range of pre-defined art styles or upload their own custom styles to guide the AI's panel generation.

Interactive Editing and Refinement: Provides a user-friendly interface for artists to edit and refine the AI-generated panels, including adjusting layouts, poses, camera angles, and adding dialogue balloons.
Collaboration Features: Enables artists and writers to collaborate on storyboards in real-time, with features for commenting, version control, and shared access.
user_journeys: A webtoon writer uploads a chapter script in .docx format. The AI parses the script and generates a complete storyboard with suggested panels, character poses, and camera angles in approximately 5-10 minutes. The writer reviews the storyboard, makes minor adjustments to panel layouts and character expressions, and shares the storyboard with the artist for feedback and further refinement. The artist then adds details, cleans up the linework, and prepares the storyboard for final production.
ai_capabilities: Scene Detection: Uses NLP techniques (e.g., sentence embeddings, semantic similarity) to identify scene breaks and key events in the script.
Panel Layout Generation: Employs a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) trained on a large dataset of webtoon panels to generate visually appealing and dynamic panel layouts.
Character Pose and Expression Generation: Utilizes a pose estimation model and generative models to suggest character poses and expressions that match the scene's emotional tone.
Object Recognition: Uses a computer vision model to recognize objects and environment details described in the script and incorporate them into the storyboard panels.

Model Selection: The system will use a combination of OpenAI's GPT models for script parsing and scene understanding, and custom fine-tuned Stable Diffusion models for image generation. Vector embeddings will be used for style matching and similarity search.

input_data_types: Script or prose in text, .docx, or .pdf format.
Optional: User-provided style references (images, style guides).
data_schema_recommendations: Panel Table: panel_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), storyboard_id (INT, FOREIGN KEY), panel_number (INT), description (TEXT), image_url (VARCHAR), layout_data (JSON).
Storyboard Table: storyboard_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), user_id (INT, FOREIGN KEY), script_name (VARCHAR), created_at (TIMESTAMP).
data_sources: Potentially: Integration with webtoon script repositories (with user permission).
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Adhere to data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) regarding user-uploaded content. Implement secure storage and access control mechanisms for user data.

required_integrations: Collaboration tools (e.g., Slack, Discord) for notifications and team communication.
Cloud storage services (e.g., Google Drive, Dropbox) for importing scripts and exporting storyboards.
Optional: Integration with webtoon publishing platforms (e.g., Webtoon, Tapas).
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: Clerk or Auth0 for secure user authentication and authorization. JWT-based authentication for API access.

technical_specifications.architecture: Microservices architecture with separate services for script parsing, AI model inference, panel generation, user interface, and data storage. API layer to facilitate communication between services.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API, fine-tuned Stable Diffusion models, vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors)
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST APIs for communication between frontend and backend services.
recommended_tech_stack.CI_CD: GitHub â†’ Vercel automatic deploy pipeline

API_design: /api/storyboards (POST): Create a new storyboard from script input. Payload: { script: string, style_id: string }.
/api/storyboards/{storyboard_id}/panels (GET): Get all panels for a storyboard.
/api/panels/{panel_id} (PUT): Update a panel's layout, pose, or description. Payload: { layout_data: JSON, description: string }.
frontend_components: Script Input Form: Component for uploading or pasting script text.
Storyboard Viewer: Component for displaying the generated storyboard panels.
Panel Editor: Component for editing individual panels, including adjusting layout, poses, and adding dialogue.
Style Selection: Component for selecting or uploading art style presets.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, STABLE_DIFFUSION_API_KEY, DB_URL, CLERK_SECRET_KEY.
Vercel deployment: Configure Vercel to deploy the frontend and backend applications from the respective directories in the GitHub repository.
Build outputs: Static HTML/CSS/JS files for the frontend, serverless functions for the backend.
Runtime settings: Node.js runtime for the backend, appropriate resource allocation for AI model inference.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers: Free (limited features), Basic, Pro, Enterprise.
Usage-based pricing: Charge per storyboard generated or per API call.
Add-ons: Premium style packs, enhanced collaboration features.

success_metrics: Operational KPIs: Number of active users, number of storyboards generated per month, average storyboard creation time.
AI performance KPIs: Accuracy of scene detection, visual quality of generated panels, user satisfaction with AI suggestions.
Adoption/engagement KPIs: User retention rate, feature adoption rate, customer satisfaction score (CSAT).
